Based on the given preferences, I would recommend either "Creepshow 2" or "A Clockwork Orange".
Both of these movies are cult classics and have been praised for their innovative storytelling and memorable performances.
In "Creepshow 2", a group of teenagers become victims to a vengeful wooden Native American, a monstrous blob in a lake, and an undying hitchhiker. The movie is filled with horror elements and will keep you on the edge of your seat.
On the other hand, "A Clockwork Orange" is a psychological drama that explores the nature of human consciousness and free will. The movie features performances by George Coulouris, Warren Clarke, Steven Berkoff, Malcolm McDowell, and many others.
